br.uff.midiacom.ana.rule
Class NCLRule<T extends NCLElement,Ev extends NCLVariable,Eb extends NCLBindRule,Et extends NCLTestRule>

All Implemented Interfaces:
NCLElement<T>, NCLTestRule<T,Eb,Et>, ReferredElement<Eb>, XMLElement<T>
public class NCLRule<T extends NCLElement,Ev extends NCLVariable,Eb extends NCLBindRule,Et extends NCLTestRule>
extends NCLIdentifiableElementPrototype<T>
implements NCLTestRule<T,Eb,Et>

Class that represents a simple rule. A rule represents a test of the value of a variable. This variable can be a system variable or defined by the document.
This element defines the attributes:

  • id - id of the simple rule element. This attribute is required.
  • var - variable tested by the rule. The variable must be a property of media with type settings. This attribute is required.
  • comparator - relates the variable to the value. This attribute is required.
  • value - value to be tested by the rule. This attribute is required.

Method Detail

setVar

public void setVar(Ev var)
            throws XMLException
Sets the variable to be tested by the rule. This attribute is required and can not be set to null. This method receives an element that makes reference to that variable.
The variable used by the rule is a global variable in the list defined by the document. The variable tested by the rule must be indicated by a property element child of a media element with type settings.
Since a rule can be defined in a document without a body, the variable remains without a reference from a property element until the document that uses the rule defines a media node of type settings, whose property indicates this variable.

Parameters:
var - element that makes reference to the variable to be tested.
Throws:
XMLException - if the variable is null or any error occur while creating the reference to the variable.

getVar

public Ev getVar()
Returns the variable to be tested by the rule or null if the attribute is not defined.
The variable tested by the rule must be indicated by a property element child of a media element with type settings. This method receives an element to make reference to that property.

Returns:
element that makes reference to the variable to be tested.

setComparator

public void setComparator(NCLComparator comparator)
                   throws XMLException
Sets the relation between the variable to the value. This attribute is required and can not be set to null. The possible comparators to be used are defined in the enumeration NCLComparator.

Parameters:
comparator - relation between the variable to the value from the enumeration NCLComparator.
Throws:
XMLException - if the value representing the comparator is null.
